title: Similar to Bookman Black, but 'pregnant' Cap U
content:
I knew this font well in 1976, but that was many careers ago.  
Sorry about the photo, it's an awning, and somewhat foreshortened.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317062740im_/http:/typophile.com/files/b_5983.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317062740im_/http:/typophile.com/files/b_3477.jpg)

Font: 

 ITC Korinna Extra Bold 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317062740/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: businessgypsy

comments.content: Reminds me of [Korinna ITC](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317062740/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/korinna/) but some details look off: upper left top decoration /U, /T angled top serifs, /E bottom terminal...
Got it in one, Ryuk! The issues you mentioned were liberties taken by signmakers in the 39 years since this was laid out. Many thanks!
